author: timesunion.com
title: Noteworthy
text:
Photo: MARK RALSTON Image 1 of / 2 2 Mercedes AMG Petronas driver Lewis Hamilton of Britain smiles at the end of the third practice session after recording the fastest time during the United States Formula One Grand Prix at the Circuit of The Americas in Austin, Texas on October 24, 2015. AFP PHOTO / MARK RALSTONMARK RALSTON/AFP/Getty Images ORG XMIT: 528112381 Mercedes AMG Petronas driver Lewis Hamilton of Britain smiles at the end of the third practice session after recording the fastest time during the United States Formula One Grand Prix at the Circuit of The ... more Image 2 of 2 Spain's David Ferrer celebrates after defeating Germany's Benjamin Becker during their men's singles semi-final match of the 2015 Malaysian Open tennis tournament in Kuala Lumpur on October 3, 2015. AFP PHOTO / MANAN VATSYAYANAMANAN VATSYAYANA/AFP/Getty Images Spain's David Ferrer celebrates after defeating Germany's Benjamin Becker during their men's singles semi-final match of the 2015 Malaysian Open tennis tournament in Kuala Lumpur on October 3, 2015. AFP PHOTO ... more Noteworthy 1 / 2 Back to Gallery Ferrer rallies to win Erste Bank Open title
SOELDEN, Austria — Eighth-ranked David Ferrer clinched his 26th career tournament win after rallying to defeat Steve Johnson of the United States 4-6, 6-4, 7-5 at the Erste Bank Open on Sunday.
The victory has all but secured him a spot at next month's season-ending ATP finals in London.
More tennis: Marin Cilic retained his title at the Kremlin Cup, beating Roberto Bautista Agut 6-4, 6-4 in a repeat of last year's final. ... Top-seeded Tomas Berdych won the Stockholm Open for a third time, beating American Jack Sock 7-6 (1), 6-2 in the final. ... Misaki Doi claimed her first WTA title with a 6-4, 6-7 (7), 6-0 win over Mona Barthel in the Luxembourg Open final. The 92nd-ranked Japanese player saved all five break points she faced to deny Barthel a fourth career title. ... Maria Sharapova won her first match since the Wimbledon quarterfinal in a 4-6, 6-3, 6-4 victory against Agnieszka Radwanska at the WTA Finals in Singapore. Sharapova was sidelined after the Wimbledon semifinals until the Wuhan tournament in China four weeks ago with a prolonged foot injury. She retired in the third set of her first match at Wuhan with a left wrist injury.
Auto racing: Lewis Hamilton seized on a late mistake by Mercedes teammate Nico Rosberg to win the United States Grand Prix and secure his third Formula One season championship. Hamilton overtook Rosberg with eight laps to go Sunday when Rosberg locked his tires and helplessly watched his teammate zoom past. Hamilton had to beat Rosberg and outscore Ferrari's Sebastian Vettel by nine points to wrap up his second consecutive championship with Mercedes. He also won with McLaren in 2008. Vettel, who could have pushed the title chase to next week in Mexico City, finished third after starting 13th.
College football: Top-ranked Ohio State (8-0) remains No. 1 in The Associated Press Top 25 poll with 39 first-place votes while Utah fell from No. 3 to No. 13 after its first loss of the season. Baylor, Clemson, LSU and TCU — the rest of the top 5 — also received first-place votes, as did No. 7 Alabama.
— Wire reports
